intro: Vilfa cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed vilfa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale blue or purple, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges and a slightly hairy surface. Vilfa cuspidata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
